pages.title: Copshowium
pages.text: <item>Copshowium/$ is an important crafting ingredient in <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/technomancy)Technomancy/$. Is is made using a <item>Copshowium Imbuer/$.$(br2)

The <item>Copshowium Imbuer/$ makes <item>molten copshowium/$ using liquids and a <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/time)time beam/$. Some (not all!) inputs also produce <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$ as a byproduct (check the JEI). The produced <item>molten copshowium/$ can be made into <item>copshowium ingots/$ <item>$(l:essentials:heat/fcc)the normal way/$.$(br2)The <item>copshowium imbuer/$ has a capacity of only 1 bucket, and unlike most machines, can have the

<item>molten copshowium/$ output overfill. If it does, <em>the machine will break/$. This is a bad thing.$(br2)It has two <item>$(l:essentials:fluid/pipe)fluid pipe/$ connections- on the top and bottom. The bottom connection is for outputting <item>molten copshowium/$, and is extract only as expected. The top output is unusual- it can accept <em>and extract/$, and can do a fluid-sharing connection with

<item>$(l:essentials:fluid/pipe)fluid pipes/$. This allows regulating how full the input tank is, which is important for preventing the output from overflowing.$(br2)When hit by a <thing>$(l:essentials:beam/time)time beam/$ (by default), any fluid in the input is converted into <item>molten copshowium/$ at the ratio set by the recipe for that fluid (check JEI for all the valid input fluids). This is when overflowing

the output is possible.$(br2)If the recipe produces <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/technomancy)temporal entropy/$, it will produce 4 per ingot of <item>molten copshowium/$ made.$(br2)<item>$(l:essentials/circuits#reader)Circuits/$ measure how full the <item>copshowium imbuer/$ is of the input fluid in total mB. Total capacity is 1440mB.$(br2)

<item>Copshowium/$ can also be used to make <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/gear_base)gears/$, like any other metal. <item>Copshowium Gears/$ are special in that their <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/rotary)I value/$ <em>is zero/$.$(br2)This means that they do not require more <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/rotary)energy/$ to spin at a higher speed. A normal gear network using a normal <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/axis)master axis/$ can not have a network of entirely zero mass (<item>copshowium/$ gears)- but can have some or most
of the gears be zero mass. There is a <item>$(l:essentials:technomancy/redstone_axis)special master axis/$ that can have only copshowium gears.$(br2)
